title: Limit of compensation; penalty
context: ยง804-62 Limit of compensation; penalty. (a) The amount of compensation which may be collected on any bail bond or bond to keep the peace by one or more persons acting as sureties thereon shall not exceed a one time only fee from five to fifteen per cent of the amount thereof, but need not be less than $50 in any event; provided that additional fees, subject to subsection (b), may be collected for: (1) The posting of a surety insurance bond as defined in section 431:1-210(1); (2) The posting of a bond on behalf of a person whose case is pending appeal; or (3) The posting of a bond in which more than one year has passed since the filing thereof. (b) The compensation collected pursuant to sections 804-62(a)(2) and (a)(3), in any year after the first year, may be collected annually, and: (1) Shall be charged on a prorated basis; and (2) Shall not exceed the percentage charged in the first year. &copy; Every person holding a license to act as surety on any bail bond or bond to keep the peace who violates this section shall be fined not more than $250 and shall forfeit the license and shall not be entitled to receive a similar license for a period of one year thereafter.
